In April 6, 2022, Plaintiffs in the Texas Defamation Trials ([[Texas Sandy Hook Lawsuit (Heslin v. Jones)|Sandy Hook]] and [[Texas Parkland Shooting Lawsuit (Fontaine v. Jones)|Parkland]]) filed a lawsuit alleging that Alex Jones had attempted to move millions of dollars away from InfoWars accounts through a fraudulent scheme involving [[PQPR]] and a variety of his family members<ref>https://www.courthousenews.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/alex-jones-tufta.pdf</ref>.

TUFTA (Texas Uniform Fraudulent Transfers Act) is a [https://statutes.capitol.texas.gov/Docs/BC/htm/BC.24.htm Texas law] which "prohibits a debtor who is subject to a valid judgment from moving assets out of reach of creditors in order to hinder, delay, or defraud a judgment creditor"<ref>https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/fraudulent-transfers-under-texas-law-1284897/</ref>.
